node.excerpt: The world’s full of pithy headlines: “How to stop procrastinating.” “Learn to code in 15 minutes.” “7 Emails you should send every week.” “How to Learn any Language in 3 Months.” They’re needy. They overpromise. And they underdeliver. They always do. This is post about learning Dutch the slow way…

frontmatter.title: Learning Dutch the Slow Way
frontmatter.description: I am not a polyglot and I do not have a natural predisposition to language learning. In language classroom settings, I'm a middling student. However, over the past year, I have managed to teach myself A2 to B1 level Dutch without attending in-person classes. Here's how.
